title: Unit 7 Checkpoint: Similarity
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of similarity ratios, triangle similarity theorems (AA, SSS~, SAS~), proportion applications, and geometric mean in right triangles.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Scale factor, setting up proportions consistently (small/large or large/small), cross-multiplication
AA (2 angles), SSS~ (all 3 ratios equal), SAS~ (2 proportional sides + included angle), order of correspondence
Shadow/indirect measurement, map scales, identifying which theorem applies

assessmentProblems.question: Two triangles have angles 40°, 65°, and 75°, and 75°, 40°, and 65° respectively. Are they similar? By what theorem?
assessmentProblems.answer: Yes, by AA Similarity (two pairs of congruent angles: 40°=40° and 65°=65°).

assessmentProblems.question: Triangle 1 has sides 5, 10, 15. Triangle 2 has sides 3, 6, 9. Are they similar? If so, state the theorem and scale factor.
assessmentProblems.answer: Check ratios: 5/3, 10/6=5/3, 15/9=5/3. All equal → SSS~ with scale factor 5:3.

assessmentProblems.question: △ABC ~ △DEF with scale factor 3:7. If AB = 12 and BC = 18, find DE and EF.
A 5-foot person casts a 4-foot shadow. A building casts a 48-foot shadow at the same time. How tall is the building?
Two similar polygons have a scale factor of 3:8. If the perimeter of the smaller polygon is 36, find the perimeter of the larger.
assessmentProblems.answer: Perimeters are in the same ratio as sides: 36 × 8/3 = 96.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the geometric mean of 7 and 28.
In a right triangle, an altitude from the right angle to the hypotenuse divides it into segments of 5 and 20. Find the altitude.
Using the same triangle (hypotenuse segments 5 and 20, hypotenuse = 25), find both legs.
In △PQR and △STU: PQ = 10, ST = 15, PR = 8, SU = 12, and ∠P = ∠S = 50°. Are the triangles similar? Name the theorem.
assessmentProblems.answer: PQ/ST = 10/15 = 2/3. PR/SU = 8/12 = 2/3. Included angle ∠P = ∠S = 50°. → SAS~ with scale factor 2:3.

assessmentProblems.question: ANALYSIS: Two similar triangles have areas in a ratio of 9:25. (a) What is the ratio of their corresponding sides? (b) If a side of the smaller triangle is 12, find the corresponding side of the larger. (c) What is the ratio of their perimeters?
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Area ratio = (side ratio)², so side ratio = √(9/25) = 3/5. (b) Side = 12 × 5/3 = 20. (c) Perimeter ratio = side ratio = 3:5.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Arc Length): A circle has radius 18 and a central angle of 100°. Find the arc length.
SPIRAL (Quadrilaterals): In parallelogram ABCD, ∠A = (3x + 20)° and ∠B = (5x - 8)°. Find x and all four angles.
